review.title: “could be better”
review.pros: Pros – -Very kind and warm team in the Curatorial Department- For the most part it was actual work, and not a coffee-and-dry-cleaning internship- Provides excellent exposure to other arts and cultural spaces in the city, through the Museum Culture Seminar held every week- A very good and sincere attempt from Guggenheim Internship Department to make the internship enriching for interns- Very open communications- Although they do not have job placements, they keep the interns and ex- interns in the loop whenever there is a job opening at the Museum.
review.cons: Cons – - Does not pay- For those who hold some work experience, the internship will not be particularly challenging. Personally I did not find the work intellectually stimulating.- Very little opportunity for working across departments, or learning what other departments are doing.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – pick up on the particular abilities and qualifications of interns, and allow them to use that to contribute positively to their work at Guggenheim. What is the point of hiring highly educated and qualified interns if they are only meant to do filing and data entry?

review.title: “Solid company to work for, but salaries could be more balanced across the board.”
review.pros: Pros – Benefits packageExcellent health insurance coverage with low employee contribution and additional coverage for domestic partnersSuccessful 403(b) retirement plan options
review.cons: Cons – Competitiveness amongst peersDisparity in salary ranges between various departmentsSome departments seem bloated with employees; others getting by with the bare minimum staff

review.title: “Great internship experience”
review.pros: Pros – All of the interns do actual work (i.e., not just fetching coffee)There are a number of departments to choose from when applying so interns are able to specialize"Museum Culture Seminars" every week in which interns are given an inside look at various aspects of the art and museum worldFree admission to the Guggenheim and any museum in the city with your staff ID
review.cons: Cons – The internship is completely unpaid though there is a stipend available to graduate student internsSome of the Museum Culture Seminars can be boring
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I only worked closely with my direct supervisor and department so I cannot speak to the overall management but I was happy with my experience

review.title: “exciting”
review.pros: Pros – collaborative, team building, can do attitude
review.cons: Cons – lots of work, work around the clock
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – more acknowledgment of staff's hard work

review.title: “Great Learning Experience”

review.cons: Cons – Not much room for growth
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Good connections, no pay”
